page.title: 19A TYPICAL SATURDAY
page.content: We asked the 10 and 11 year olds in our class how they spent each Saturday. Most of them said that they did the same things each week. A few of the girls had dancing classes to go to in the morning. All the girls said that they 'went to town' every Saturday. This means that they go into St. Helier to go shopping. They meet a friend first, and then look around the clothes shops. A few of the boys have paper rounds in the morning, and some played football for their school or cub-scout pack. Watching television is very popular amongst the boys, 'Saturday Superstore', a magazine programme that lasts all morning was the most commonly watched. In the evening watching a video tape with the family or going to sleep at a friend's house were the most usual ways of ending a Saturday.
